author: rooneg
msg: Attempt to reduce the number of bug reports from users who are used to using
'svn diff -x' and are confused by the internal diff library's inability to
reproduce all the options of GNU diff.
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_INVALID_DIFF_OPTION): new error code.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(diff_file_changed): when using our internal diff code, return an
SVN_ERR_INVALID_DIFF_OPTION error if the client specified any diff options
other than -u.

author: kfogel
msg: Refix issue #1160: the ra_svn server can crash when serving from a
legacy repository that doesn't have checksums for some files.
This was originally fixed in revision 5474, but this change redoes it
in a more extensible way, by wrapping the optional checksum in its own
tuple.  Thanks to Matt Kraai and Greg Hudson for the review.
* subversion/svnserve/serve.c
(get_file): Send hex_digest in its own tuple, which is empty if
hex_digest is null.  Restore it to the first position.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/client.c
(ra_svn_get_file): Read optional expected_checksum first, as before.

author: bdenny
msg: Fix typo in comment

author: philip
msg: While 'svn mkdir URL' can't create a versioned directory called .svn,
there are more devious ways to do it.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/update_tests.py
(update_receive_illegal_name): Don't skip.  Use mkdir then mv to
create a versioned .svn directory.

author: philip
msg: Fix a bug where an SVN_ERR_FS_CONFLICT error raised during commit did
not get back to the client when using ra_svn.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/marshal.c (svn_ra_svn_handle_commands): Flush
after writing a failure response.  Don't ignore errors.
* subversion/svnserve/serve.c (commit): Only write the rev/date/author
if there commit completed without error.
